title: Implementation Science Project-Based Learning for Cancer Prevention and Management

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of public health and pedagogy, general awareness of cancer prevention
context.additional_context: Course for pre-service teachers to cultivate the ability to design and evaluate cancer prevention strategies applicable to real educational settings

learning_goals: Learners can explain core principles of implementation science in cancer prevention and management and apply them to practical cases.
Through literature reviews and case analyses, learners can critically evaluate effective cancer prevention strategies.
Via project-based learning, learners can design cancer prevention education programs using interdisciplinary approaches and develop implementation plans.
Learners can propose realistic cancer management policies considering cost-effectiveness and resource utilization.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
